text: welcome everyone I am Niharika and in
today's lesson we are gonna look at some
things to avoid by learning English now
I have observed many English learners do
certain things that kind of hurt their
progress well in this lesson you're
gonna look at two some points that you
really need to avoid if you want to be
fluent in English the very first thing
don't be ashamed to speak up well that's
what happens you know many of my English
students well the first thing that comes
out of their mouth is I'm too
embarrassed I'm too shy well if you say
this that's it you are not going to
learn to speak confidently if you are
ashamed of speaking in English what's
the point how are you gonna achieve your
goal so no worries if you are not great
in your vocabulary you don't have to
worry if your pronunciation is not right
or if your accent is not right it's okay
we are learners remember so go ahead and
speak confidently open your mouth and
speak don't be ashamed so the second
thing don't be frustrated with yourself
but we all come across the stage
especially learners well if you're
learning English or any of the language
there is a point that you will face
frustration but that should not upset
you because the more you'll get
frustrated you won't be able to learn
you won't be able to progress now you
know there are times when you are unable
to describe something fully in English
especially the way you would do it in
the only
of language that's okay there are all
the times and you just don't get that
right word out of your mouth and your
mind just gets completely blocked that
is also all okay I mean you don't have
to be frustrated you don't have to show
that oh my god I am NOT progressing it
is fine don't get frustrated you got to
be calm and composed
and you need patience you have to show
patience especially when you are
learning a new language so avoid getting
frustrated
[Music]
the third thing don't take it personally
when someone doesn't understand you well
that happens you know it's not necessary
that whatever you try to say the other
person is gonna understand you well in
this world there are various accents
okay people from Australia would have a
different accent people from Ireland
would have a different accent even in
America different parts of America
people speak differently so if if they
are not able to understand your accent
it is alright it's not necessary that
they should get you the first time right
there will be times when people will say
pardon me excuse me I'm sorry I didn't
get to you now these points should not
upset you don't take it too personal
it's okay
just try to speak softly and in a very
calm manner okay so that people
understand you and if they don't it's
okay you still gotta talk right also you
gotta be very patient with English
learners you know you are probably at a
different stage okay you have more
knowledge more exposure and you have a
lot of vocabulary as compared to someone
who's just started learning English so
you know that person would not be able
to understand your vocabulary or that
person will not be able to
understand what you're trying to say so
it's okay remember you were also at that
point some time ago so be patient and
don't take these things too personally
[Music]
the fourth point is that do not compare
yourselves with other English speakers
that is the biggest mistake that most of
the English learners do you know they
expect to speak as fluently as any
native speaker like you know there are
times when someone would come up to me
and say hey in America I have been
learning English past two years why
can't I speak the way you do well just
be happy with the level that you are at
you have worked very hard so be happy
with that accomplishment you know it's
okay because there are people who learn
easily there are people who take a lot
of time to learn certain things so it's
alright you don't have to keep comparing
but yes we are human beings and we tend
to compare a lot but when it comes to
learning a language please don't do that
do not compare yourself because every
person learns in a different manner
[Music]
Alyce's point if you are fluent don't be
arrogant well that's what happens you
know once you are very fluent and
speaking English there are people who
have this arrogance who try to be very
cocky well please don't do that because
English is not a chip in your brain it's
a complete learning process you are or
you have no right to insult anyone you
know there are people that I come across
if they speak very well they tend to
insult the others that's not fair
you know probably it took you a lot of
time to learn English right at some time
ago you were also at the beginner level
so please don't have that attitude like
I know it all okay that's not fair for
the other person you need to be nice and
you need to be patient with other
